It is characterized by its delicate, translucent fronds that give it a ghost-like appearance, especially when backlit. The plant thrives in humid, shaded environments, typically found in tropical rainforests. Due to its fragile nature and limited distribution, Myoxanthus epibator is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
